page.title: 18Glebe Farm, Hanworth
page.content: The farm, comprising a brick and flint farmhouse and 365 acres of top grade farmland was until 1982, part of Gunton Estate. Modern technology purpose- built stock buildings, machinery etc. has resulted in a highly productive mixed farm, run by the Attew family much aware of the later developments in farming. Most of the grazing land lies within Gunton Park. 500 pheasants are reared in the dividing belt of mixed woodland. As a hobby,Michael Attew (farmer) breeds about 60 red canaries which he shows all over the British Isles. He is President of The Red Canary Association CCBA, and judges at many European bird shows.
